In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone.

Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around.

In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to sit down and read without being di

In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobook

When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a b

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at

When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book t

I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found

In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you c

When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I pr

Is Listening to a Book Just as Good as Reading It?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

Do you listen to audiobooks? What are the benefits, in your opinion, of listening instead of reading? Are there advantages to reading that cannot be gained by listening? Which method do you prefer? Why?

---

In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenie

In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having

In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to read o

I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before

In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me.

---

In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love rea

In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical boo

In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both method

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both methods give a unique e

In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both methods give a unique experience to the reade

I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both methods give a unique experience to the reader and I don't think eit

I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both methods give a unique experience to the reader and I don't think either method is going

I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both methods give a unique experience to the reader and I don't think either method is going to go away anytime soo

In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both methods give a unique experience to the reader and I don't think either method is going to go away anytime soon. It ultimately come

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both methods give a unique experience to the reader and I don't think either method is going to go away anytime soon. It ultimately comes down to personal pr

When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both methods give a unique experience to the reader and I don't think either method is going to go away anytime soon. It ultimately comes down to personal preference and situati

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both methods give a unique experience to the reader and I don't think either method is going to go away anytime soon. It ultimately comes down to personal preference and situation.

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both methods give a unique experience to the reader and I don't think either method is going to go away anytime soon. It ultimately comes down to personal preference and situation.

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both methods give a unique experience to the reader and I don't think either method is going to go away anytime soon. It ultimately comes down to personal preference and situation.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both methods give a unique experience to the reader and I don't think either method is going to go away anytime soon. It ultimately comes down to personal preference and situation.

In my opinion, there are benefits to listening compared to reading when it comes to books. The first one that pops into my head is the ability to listen to a book while I'm on the go. When I am driving to work I can put an audiobook on and get the information that way. Obviously when I am driving I have to focus on the road and therefore wouldn't be able to read a physical book on my commute.

I also love that audiobooks don't take up any physical space. A book shelf can get packed very quickly and then decisions have to be made. I don't really like to throw books out because I like them for decoration purposes. With an audiobook, I simply have it stored on an app that I can only using my laptop or my cell phone. I also can access these no matter where I am. As people we always have our cell phones on us. I find it much harder to carry a book around. 

The advantages that I think come with an actual book is the ability to read at your own pace. Some audiobooks the speed is too high or too low no matter how much you change the speed settings. When I read a physical book, I can read at my own pace. 

I also enjoy looking at the pictures in a book that are specifically found in biographies. Since an audiobook is just audio, you can't see the pictures. 

I prefer to use audiobooks just because of the convenience of them. I love having the ability to lay in my bed before I go to sleep and listen to a chapter. It helps relax me. 

I also want to make it clear that I love reading physical books as well. Both methods give a unique experience to the reader and I don't think either method is going to go away anytime soon. It ultimately comes down to personal preference and situation.
